{{Unreferenced stub|auto=yes|date=December 2009}} [[Image:ZitronensÃ¤ure - Citric acid.svg|thumb|[[Citric acid]]]]
A '''tricarboxylic acid''' is an [[organic chemistry|organic]] [[carboxylic acid]] whose [[chemical structure]] contains three [[carboxyl group|carboxyl]] [[functional group]]s (-COOH). The best-known example of a tricarboxylic acid is [[citric acid]].
==Examples== *[[Citric acid]] *[[Isocitric acid]] *[[Aconitic acid]] *[[Propane-1,2,3-tricarboxylic acid]] (tricarballylic acid, carballylic acid) *[[Trimesic acid]]
==See also== *[[Citric acid cycle]] (tricarboxylic acid cycle) *[[Dicarboxylic acid]] *[[Mellitic acid]]
{{DEFAULTSORT:Tricarboxylic Acid}} [[Category:Carboxylic acids]]
